poem:
Title: The Unseen Edge

In the heartland's severe discourse, a hawk bends,
Her words, like the wind, troughing the yellow grass.
An economic cliff hulks, unseen. A truth wends -
Fateful vehicles in the rush of time's fast hourglass.
Her self-service, loud as the crow's black caw;
Yet, as silent as the edge of Trollope's tragic fall.
